properties.title: fail at traffic circle in front of cops
irrigate disused driveway in front of i-90 traffic
delicious berries and peach at farm stand
properties.description: After crossing over to the US-20, I found a farmstand that had homegrown blueberries that were exquisite as well as plenty of other veggies. I had a peach as well. The owner was lovely and we discussed road safety before she wished me well for the trip.

properties.title: white chocolate reeses are weird and jalapeno queso stuffed pretzel aint my thing
properties.description: Right before arriving in Fredonia, NY, I stopped by a gas station offering jalapeño stuffed pretzels. Intrigued, I bought one, but could not pick out the jalapeño notes.

properties.title: i am going to die on this road
meet mark the fellow bike tourer
properties.description: After arriving on the Pennsylvania side, having passed the evocatively named North East, I saw another bike tourer approach on the horizon. I waved both arms in the air and he came over to my side. His name was Mark, newly retired from outside of Pittsburgh, and was well into his ride from the westernmost to easternmost points in the US. We had a long chat - he told me about getting a free wheel from Trek after his blew up in Munising, Michigan. He was kind and raved about Olympic and North Cascades National Parks.

properties.title: early dinner at awesome diner
properties.description: I made it into Erie shortly thereafter, where I went to a fantastic diner called New York Lunch, ate a truckload of food, including a delicious Greek salad, and enjoyed the rather dated decor. This was right near my campground for the night on the lakeshore.

properties.title: early night at campground
properties.description: At the campground I met my fellow campers across the way - retirees living out of their RV. The wife had done bike tours in Europe and asked to see my setup. I obliged and we chatted about, once again, road safety, before she wished me well for the rest of my trip.
